title: Financial Management
content:
Service Management's Financial Management module helps you manage money in an efficient and effective way, so as to align with enterprise strategy and achieve business objectives. It assists with budget planning and the execution, monitoring, and control of financial resources.

The Financial Management module allows you to record or refer to financial details of the following:

  • Fixed assets, such as accounting codes, depreciation, and residual value
  • Reconciled IT assets, including devices, infrastructure and peripherals, and fixed asset licenses
  • Cost centers, such as effective date, manager, and reporting center
  • Cost types
  • Financial assets, including account codes, budgets, budget centers, budget types, and budget lines
  • Assets related to financial scheduling, including accounting periods and fiscal years
  • View expense lines generated based on configured cost allocation rules or created manually with expense line capability enabled.

Difference between Accounting codes and Account code:

  • Accounting code:  Is a string used in fixed assets for quick import/export.
  • Account code: Is an entity used to synchronize the budget and cost with financial system. 

The module also enables you to set simulation criteria to simulate the possible values for the specified assets after a certain period. With this module, you can view all your assets from a financial perspective.
